Interface Player

All Superinterfaces:
Constants
All Known Implementing Classes:
NaivePlayer, RandomPlayer
public interface Player
extends Constants

An interface which defines how a player is to be implemented. Any player program MUST implemented this interface. What you have to do is just implement an instance of this class. Given a board, the function getMove should return a valid move. The different functions in Board class can be used for help, though you are free to do anything with your personal copy of Board.

Field Summary
 
Fields inherited from interface Constants
BLACK, NONE, SIZE, WHITE
 
Method Summary
 Move getMove(Board b)
          Given the board b, make a valid move for this board situation.
 

Method Detail

getMove

public Move getMove(Board b)
Given the board b, make a valid move for this board situation. You are allowed to do anything with your personal copy of your board. This function (that you will implement) should return a valid move.
